text: Butterknife is a library which helps to make your code cleaner, in effect
Ah sorry, I see you're referring to your boolean
ok reading
I’d do something like that
Yes, unless you put a reference to your boolean outside your anonymous class scope it will be cleaned up on garbage collection
I’d use a `ToggleButton` with a `selector`
Views are declared private at the top of the class, and set in `onCreate()`
so you do declare as class property
Just a class variable
setImage
just reading docs on that
Tbh, just avoid keeping state variables from ui changes, it will give you headache
You set them up usually in `onCreate()`, though if you have a large number of views then additional methods may help to set them up
oh sorry thats your method
yeah ok I see how it all hangs together
Yeah, it’s a method that does one thing, which can then be called throughout the class
wow ok
that makes a lot more logical sense
So if you want another button that sets the image to a fish, you call it with false
I was trying to be way too terse
Or you can create a method which takes an Image Resource and just set to that
Remember that your UI can be torn down at any time
etc
right
ok I need to get better at being a little more verbose and creating extra methods as I need them, rather than trying to create some crazy short and elegant logic
thankyou
big help
Biggest thing to help is to rely only on "pure" methods
Methods that take only input and produce output, and dont affect state
They could basically be static
Having methods that only do one thing is actually a really big help in code
Well defined, well named methods are probably one of the hardest things to learn haha
Other than naming variables :stuck_out_tongue:
Absolutely :wink:
I say an awesome article on naming vars actually, let me see if I can find it
God I’ve spent so long working out naming conventions, only to change them all a week later
<https://twitter.com/codinghorror/status/506010907021828096?lang=en-gb>
